review: First of all I love Red Robin and even worked for them for 10 plus years... I NEVER GET TIRED OF THEIR DELICIOUS FOOD!!! One day had rough experience with a server but when I called later and talked to manager "Kate" (1/2018) She was the most understanding, open and wonderful example of a management professional!!! I don't care if servers screw things up, as long as Kate is there she has GOT IT HANDLED! But I will say the servers are genuinely awesome and this one experience was rare:) Awesome restaurant for adults and families!!! Fun activities for kids, amazing mixed drinks and deserts! And don't get me started on the phenomenal burgers and salads!!!

Like most big chains, this Red Robbin location can be inconsistent with service and food quality.  Ate lunch today with the family and service was quick, food was standard Red Robbin quality, good, not great. Looked like we arrived before the big lunch crowd so we didn't have to wait for a table.

This place sucks. Here's my story: Came in last night around 9pm. There was two family's waiting to be seated, and the front booth where the seater stands is totally abandoned. Finally after waiting about 5 minutes, the husband of the family To our left got kinda annoyed I think and went to hunt down the girl to sit his family Down(lol).  After that bs, we get sat down. Now I didn't get this girls name, but our waiter had the shittiest attitude I've encountered in a while. She had messed up eyebrows, dark hair in a pony tail in jeans. She literally had the worst attitude and acted like she was about to quit any second haha. At one point she collect e our menus and slammed them down in the back. As well as slammed our cash down on our table after we payed. Most likely because I didn't tip her ass. Do you expect a tip after acting like that? What world do you live in, idiot.  Do not come here there's much better Red Robin's our there besides this one.
Came here for dinner with the family. Service was good and food was okay.  I had the sriachi burger and it came with bottomless  fries. A good deal at $9.49. We Love coming here.

Haven't been to a RR since a free birthday burger in 2013. Stopped by this one on our way back to LA after 8 hours in the car, so just about anything would taste good! We were surprised it was so busy for 8:45pm on a Tuesday/school night but it is right next to a huge cinema in a mall. Service time was perfectly reasonable for how busy they were. The $6.99 double burgers (4 to choose from) and bottomless fries special is not a Gourmet extravaganza, but it is a Great deal, especially if you're on a budget. Can't even get that good a deal at Habit. I had the tavern double and hubby the smokey jack/BBQ. Not massive patties by any means but they were tasty and well constructed- I didn't even add ketchup as all the toppings and sauce were perfectly proportioned. Pickles and red onion added to mine by request at no charge and allergy questions answered straight away.  Our waitress, Megan, was lovely too! Very nice, helpful, and attentive!

Worst service , we wait 20 min to be seated (yes, was a busy day) then the hosted seated us and the last table of the restaurant. Many servers pass and nobody welcomed us our let us know somebody will came . We wait patiently for  20 minutes until I realized that many other customers who came after us were been serve, before I leave I let the hostess know about the waiting but she didn't apologize. Let me tell this is no the first time that happened in this location. DONt come to this restaurant!!!!
Burgers are ok (nothing special) but let's be real, the reason we go here is for the fries. Servers are friendly and attentive which I appreciate. One of the cleaner locations I have been to.
Ordered a garden burger with American cheese, they convinced my husband this is it.. it's not.

We rarely go to Red Robin, maybe once every year as there are usually a good number of places that serve better burgers (or wraps/salads if that's what you're looking for) at about the same price.  We came here on a Friday night, after a lot of indecisiveness on where to grab some food, made it before the dinner rush. Noticed it was happy hour, but after checking out the deals (which were severely lacking) just ordered off the regular menu. They advertise all of their local "craft brews" they carry now, but unless you want happy hour bud lights or coors, I wouldn't even bother going here for happy hour. Anyways, got the fiery ghost tavern double and the whiskey BBQ burger. My kids got the grilled cheese and the mac n cheese meals off the kids menu. My fiery ghost burger was ok, had a lot of heat from the sauce (which pretty much made the bun a soggy mess) but wasn't anything spectacular. The whiskey BBQ burger is what I usually get, and my girlfriend thought it was good. Kids meal were what you would expect but were priced well (I think $5 for entree, side, and a drink). Overall, 3 stars for the bottomless steak fries, which are usually the best part, and the service which was great. They are sort of working through that awkward "self-service tablet on the table, but you can still order through the waiter" ordeal, so that could be a little confusing, but our waiter and the hostess was nice and attentive. Red Robin, we'll probably see you in another year or so.

Being there within the last hour of being closed we knew service was going to be a little off due to the closing procedures. W Once inside we ended up waiting at the front for about 10 minutes waiting to be seated. Once seated we asked for our drinks and the server forgot the water we asked. Once we received our food the server left us with no forks, napkins, ranch, or bleu cheese. I had a salad so a fork was needed. We didn't eat until 5 minutes of waiting for the server to come back. The food was delicious though. I received the bleu ribbon burger and it was good but could use some acidity, so add some pickles on the side.

I have been to this Red Robin location few times and I have always had good experience. Their food is really good and their staff are very professional. I usually get the bruschetta chicken sandwich with extra avocado. Its really good and I highly recommend it. Last time I went, I had their southwest salad and added Salmon. It was amazing, their Salmon was cooked perfectly! Today I went and grabbed a togo order. The service was exceptional. I couldn't have asked for better staff. Katherine was really nice and helpful. She came and took my togo order, as I was waiting for my order to be ready, she brought complementary free. I thought that was nice. thank you for the wonderful service and I will be back soon
Came for a holiday party. Was told they didn't take reservations but they could fit me in

I've been here a few times and I am always super happy. The last time I visited was in Valentine's Day and our server, Megan, was the most helpful and delightful person I've ever encounter.  If I had to work on Valentine's Day I'd probably be a complete nightmare, a moody cow. Not this girl. She went above and beyond to make sure I enjoyed my one childless evening.  My go to meal is the chicken Ensenada platter. It is soooooo good. The  salad that goes with it is amazing.  My hubby always tries one or other burger. And he is always super happy. The flavors are amazing and the place is clean and the service is amazing. I see myself going to this Red Robin for a long time.  Ask for Megan. She's amazing!!!!
Staff is friendly, thought it was pricey for the quality of the food. Also I think the menu is a little generic, Red Robin doesn't seem to offer a specialty burger that makes it unique.

It's A Ok reasonably priced variety of burgers.  When we came in it was about a 25 minute wait.  I came with my husband and 2 year old.  The lady asked if we needed a high chair and I said no she can sit in a regular chair.  When they called our name about 25 minutes later they tried to sit us at the bar area with 2 seat tables.  The guy said we should of told them we had a kid.  I kindly told him I did and she asked and we told her we would need a regular seat not a high chair. The waiter then argued with me saying it was our fault and the girl did not put that in their so we were going to have to wait to be seated at another table.  If I didn't have a gift card I probably would of walked out as he was very rude and made us feel like we inconvenienced them for having a child with us.   2nd note I order a childs cheesebuger and when the order came in the fries were so hot they burnt her tongue! I was so disappointed in our night out I can't imagine going through this bad customer service again :( sad face

Just finished lunch or early dinner for 3 and it was good. Janae was our server and she was fast and friendly with a great smile. The appetizers were good both the spinach and artichoke dip and chips and the cheese sticks. The veggie burger for me and the other 2 tavern burgers were small but tasty as everyone said. We wanted to try the mac and cheese but they forgot to make and bring it so we just took it of the bill since we were full anyways. The chocolate cake fudge Sunday was good I just wish it came without the berry sauce.

Me red robin song goes something like this.... reeeed robin, yuck.  Our meals are always just ok. Its so loud and the tables are crap and slanted. And they have those ridiculous little pads on stands for you to order and pay (getting rid of servers?) And dont forget the games kids can play...at a cost without permissions needed. Yah. No. The iced tea had a syrup in which i wasnt aware of until i took a sip...she could have stirred it. Just not great. We have gone in a few times to see if it was a fluke thing and its not. We wont be back.

One of the better locations for a Red Robin, right by the mall and not too far from the movie theatre so we can get a bite to eat after the movies because we know that the popcorn isn't enough to hold us over. I got the onion rings tower here and it was crispy and delicious with two options for sauces. I also got the bacon mac and cheese with a side salad and that was delicious in itself, 4 different cheese!?!?! yes, please!  The host seated us immediately even though it was a holiday week and our waitress was on top of things at all times. I was pretty impressed with this location as far as service goes.

I love the food options here. I am a pretty plain eater and my husband is not.  I like that they have options that suite us both. This is usually my go-to place because I love their fries with seasoning.  I went there a week ago with hubs for a kid-free mini adventure.  Living la vida loca. The strawberry daiquiris I had were AMAZING. SO good. Darn good job on those. It wasn't too pricey either. Great service, delicious food.

People can be so picky. I get it. But trust me when I say, this is one of the better locations. Our waitress was very attentive and very nice. We usually try not to think of red robin to go eat, but this one is great. Food is fresh and hot. Loved it. And free burger for my veteran hubby on veteran's day. Thank you RR for taking care of us. You want a bad location, go to Escondido. I loved this one.

Pretty cool place. The atmosphere was really accommodating for people with children. The server was great although the fries she originally brought out were cold... the madlove burger was just ok.. nothing special.

I have been to this Red Robin's, but it's been a while. My hubby decide on having burgers and suggested RR. This place has really down graded since our last visit. The margarita's tasted like lemonade & the water taste like pipe...gross!! We decided to check this place off our food list & never to return. Good thing the have bottomless fries!!

Service was good but both of our meals were clearly sitting for awhile, the buns were VERY dry. Very disappointing bc it's not hard to have fresh burger buns or deliver food that seems hot. This is a childhood favorite place for my husband but after this we won't be back.

I'm still here but thought I would start this now. First I start every review at 3 stars when they are a chain and go from there. Got seated immediately but then waited about 20 mins for someone to take our order. It wasn't incredibly busy so not sure why it took so long. Eventually I pushed the call server and someone woke up and came over within a minute. Might have something to do with the flashing red light. So it went from 3 to 1 for the delay. Let me add that I watched two of the wait staff walk lazily down another aisle 5 mins before. A couple sat before us in the same section and had been sitting there before us walked out just a few moments before I hit the call server button. Funny they showed up pretty fast then. I'm not sure this is the way it's really supposed to work. I'm finishing this a few days later. I'm keeping it a 1 as this is not the way things usually are here but was such a departure from what I've come to expect that it just needs to stay that way until I go back ( and I know I will as the family loves Red Robin)

Good food and great service. They don't take reservations but most places don't anymore. Probably because parties can't show up on time anymore but they were very accommodating once my party showed up

I love this place. The food is consistently good and the price is amazing. I usually get the Whiskey river something, chicken burger, regular burger or wrap and it's amazing. The sauces are on point! Best honey mustard in the land and the sweet chili is delicious as well. I love coming here with my family! Anthony is our regular waiter and he is awesome!!!
No bathroom paper! Very dirty in restroom anywhere.   Order wrong 2 times been wait long won't come again!

Nostalgia and the thought of bottomless steak fries brought us back here. While this was a go-to after sports competitions when I was younger, I think I'll leave this place for my memories.  All fried foods were good, we had stomach aches afterwards and had to box up our burgers to go. Everything was as good as we remembered which is to say we'll be back again in another 8-10 years.

Went to eat here with my husband who is disabled. He uses a walker and is on oxygen. The hostess was very thoughtless. She wanted to seat us at the back of restaurant where we would have to try and squeeze through tables and chairs where people were sitting I asked if we could sit somewhere else. She said yes.  About 10 minutes later she sat a couple with a stroller right across from us. No one could get through because of my husband's walker and the stroller. My husband and I felt sooo uncomfortable so we moved. We would have left if we hadn't ordered our food. They have no consideration for disabled people. We told our waitress and she just laughed it off. Will not go back there again

We were regulars at Red Robin, would go weekly. Sometimes even twice a week! Then one day they changed there policy on us and decided to start charging for soda water. Which is fine, but for $3!!! Really? It barely even cost 25cents to produce! It's water (no syrup) with some co2. The waitress shared with us she had a ton of upset customers. Haven't been back since.

Real great. Service was on point, our server/waiter Cameron was funny and nice, and we got our food fast, he goes out of his way to serve you. Also, the food here was great, we ordered the double tavern and that was the first time I didn't remove anything. The steak fries are real nice too. They're big but not mushy like other ones. You'll have the meal of a lifetime here.
Super welcoming and helpful staff! Great food for reasonable prices. This is definitely one of my favorite go-to spots to have a tasty burger. Also, join the rewards program! :)
This Red Robin's is very nice. The whole atmosphere is clean and has a very cool vibe to it. Service is fast and friendly. Food is good and portions are generous.

Overall 3.5 stars. Located in the mall near the Edwards movie theater in Temecula, I used to go to this location prior to moving to SD. My girlfriends & I do our annual birthday lunch at a RR. Since all of our birthdays are in the same month, we all get our lunch for free! Yay! TIP: Join the Red Royalty club. You get special deals, including a free burger (you can make it a monster for free too) during your birthday month. They also frequently have special deals for members. Every 10 burgers/salad/sandwich, you get one free.

I have been here several times and I have never been disappointed.  The service has always been good and their food is really delicious for a chain restaurant. I did take away one star for the cleanliness of the tables and bathroom...they need to pay closer attention to that...but I am always in the mood for a ice cold iced tea and a whisky river chicken wrap!
Real good experience  Good food and excellent and friendly service  The rewards program is legit  Highly recommended

Delicious zucchini with ranch, fast friendly server Cameron, nice ambiance. Ordered a avocado, Cobb salad great variety of bacon, hard boiled eggs, cheese, veggies and grilled chicken. Our server was very attentive, bringing ranch and making sure our drinks were topped off. Very nice lunch experience.

Friends and I, party of 4, walk in at 8pm on a Wednesday. There was no host at the time so we stood around waiting.... even drew on their chalk board selfie wall that they have in the front to pass time. no one greeted us at all. My friend yelled out "hello! We are here!"  I walked around the host stand to see if we could flag down someone or be noticed, but no server in sight. We waited around for 20 fucking minutes and left to Yard House instead.  The restaurant wasn't busy at all, lots of empty tables alongside multiple taken tables here and there. After walking out, I did notice what looked like two servers talking and writing stuff BEHIND the host stand towards the bar, but at this point we were looking through the window from the outside in.  Tf? ALWAYS PAY ATTENTION to the front of the house Red Robin!

What do you think of when you hear, "Red Robin"?  That song goes off in your head.  Maybe you even sing it.  That was me before today.  The song playing in my mind right now is, "Are you kidding me?"  My friend and I decided to go to lunch at RR.  We were both looking forward to a great meal, something not coming from the office refrigerator.  I told my friend about the new commercial for the $6.99 Tavern Burgers.  I ordered one of the Tavern Burgers and my friend asked if they had something with bacon on it and that she needed a gluten free bun.  When they brought the burgers, I was very surprised at the size of the burgers.  We both had delicious lemon water with our burgers.  The server brought separate checks.  Mine was $7.55 and hers was darn close to $15.00.  We were very disappointed that the waiter didn't tell her the price of the burger, or at least, offer the tavern burger and just add the bacon and gluten free bun ($8.50).  He should have told her, buckle up.  Your burger's going to be $11.49 plus $1.50 for the bacon and another $1 for the gluten free bun.  She doesn't like confrontation and didn't want to say anything.  She's kind of a chalk it up to experience gal.  Hmmm, not this girl.  When the manager came to clear a few plates, she muscled the courage to speak to the manager.  Here's where it gets good.  My friend, very politely, explained to the manager that we basically had the same meals but hers was double the price.  I don't know where this manager got her training, but it went from bad to worse.  The manager explained that my burger was a "kiddie burger, made from two FROZEN 2.5 oz patties."  She said my friend's was a 6 oz patty.  She was totally unfazed that she had just told us their gourmet burgers were created using FROZEN patties.  My friend explained that maybe the server could have told her how much the burger cost.  She gave an example that at Mickey D's if you try to order individually, they tell you to combo it and give you the combo price.  It was just good policy and maybe she would like to mention that to the server.  She shockingly told us that the servers earn points based on the sales and so they try to sell the more expensive.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME SMALLS?  Who would admit to the customer that we just ripped you off?  I couldn't sit back any longer so out it came...I asked if she had ordered my burger for $6.99 and added the bacon how much would they have charged.  She then must have brightly realized she should stop talking. We never wanted anything free but to have such a lame, outlandish excuse is beyond reason.  Come on "Reeeeeedddddd  Rooooobbbbbbbiiinnnn" you are making a ton of money.  If you are going to advertise $6.99 burgers, tell people they are smaller and stop saying they are 'double burgers' when even you refer to them as Kiddie double burgers.  Secondly, $15 for a burger and water is over the top GREEDY.  Knock it off.
Best flippin burger ever! Love this place! If you haven't already done Red Robin, it sucks for you!

Its been a while Our server was Amber. She greeted us as soon we sat down which is rare now a days and especially rare for my husband and I.  She was very pleasant and constantly smiled. I wish I could base my review just on her. My drink I ordered was called the merry moscato punch. It was sweet, fruity, and served with a pineapple garnish which are all good things in my book.  I love Red Robin for two main reasons...the bottomless fries and the campfire sauce. Yummy in my tummy. My husbands burger was very juicy. My chicken burger sandwich with goat cheese was below average. The bread was soggy it fell apart in my hands.  and the salsa that came with it was gross.  The location to the movie theater is perfect.

UPDATE! REMODELED! And they must have overhauled the staff, too. Clean now. Service is MUCH better and new menu is delicious. Have been back a few times now and not disappointed at all. Good job Red Robin.

I've always had good service here. My favorite is the whiskey river chicken wrap and onion ring tower. I think it's the service that always brings me back here. It could be a packed house and I never feel neglected by our server. Good job, Red Robin's!

I love Red Robin (RR) because their burgers are some of the best around. They have bottom less fries which are very tasty and most of the employees are very helpful. Several months of ago I was on a search for the best burger in the Temecula valley and San Diego county. Well to get to the point RR came in third and I've been to a few burger joints. I'm proud of RR because of  they are consistent with the burgers and the fries. To me the fries are very important as a side.  I can never go wrong with a burger at RR and writing this review is making me hungry.

The Temecula location (3.5 stars) seems to be better quality of food than the North County Fair Mall (2.5 stars) location. Being primarily a vegan/vegetarian, I only eat burgers 2-3 times per year. My wife signed us up for the birthday club. I have the turkey burger whenever I come to any Red Robin, and it was well prepared on this latest visit, albeit, the cooks slightly messed up our order. Parking is usually difficult, as it's located at the mall.  And since there's really nowhere to eat in Temecula (all chains/fast food), the mall is always packed. But overall, it's a decent place to get a burger.
Their service is the worst... I dread going here, so I've stopped going. Their old, bald manager is a douchebag too.

Came in on Saturday night for my free Bday burger and the place had a 25 min wait which was ok cus there were quite a bit of people. I ordered the royal burger and I gotta say its pretty awesome. We had some issues with how long it took to get our orders and how they charge you for certain sauces which I find absolutely absurd. I got charged for literally a tablespoon of their ghost sauce. Waitress didn't inform me they charged I found out as I was looking at our receipt on the kiosk at our table. I'm just saying just let your customers know cus if I had I wouldn't of ordered it. It's the principal not the amount it cost. Our meals all tasted good surprisingly, its just the wait to get those meals is the problem. Might go back someday if I were in the area but there's other restaurants around there that I would try out first.

This restaurant is run beautifully.  From the moment we walked in, the service was phenomenal.  It was very busy at the time and we received our drinks and food in a timely manner.  My family and I had a great time and the food was great.  I definitely recommemd it to anyone looking for a nice restaurant at a reasonable price.

I haven't patronized any of the Red Robin restaurants in about 12 years, my last time was in the Midwest in Michigan and the service / meat quality of the burger was terrible.  My sister recently came from Kentucky to visit me here in Cali for several days and she was boasting about how amazing the Blue Ribbon burger at Red Robin was. I smiled at her and kind of politely blew her off and didn't go into detail about the bad experience I had 12 years ago. About two weeks after my sister left she sent me a package in the mail and it contained a gift card for Red Robin. She attached a sticky note to the card and written on it was a reminder for me to try the Blue Ribbon burger no pink. I was a bit hesitant and almost re gifted the card to someone else lol  I trusted my sisters judgement and went for it, well my sister was right and the burger was amazing, in fact it's probably one of the best burgers I've ever eaten. The burger was well done and the meat quality was fresh, I could taste the blue cheese without it over powering the all around flavor of the meat and sauce.  I chose to substitute the regular fries for sweet potato fries which were really fresh and tasty, also ordered a Stella on tap to wash everything down (what a great combo). I consider myself a burger connoisseur considering I've traveled and lived all over the world tasting burgers and fries. I even barbecue and pan fry a fantastic burger myself ;) Thanks to my sister ;) Red Robin has become my new favorite blue ribbon burger place, the staff is friendly and attentive and the service is efficient enough to help create a great atmosphere for friends and family!

1 hr to get seated people came in after us got seated before us. Then another hr for food to come our way. Are you freaking kidding me?? Only reason we stayed was because one of our guest really wanted to try Red Robin burgers only to be hugely disappointed.  Food was not on point at all been to other Red Robin locations and this place just did not compare.

Ate here today (9/16/2017) and had a great time. The server Jenna is amazing, very attentive, and on point with the menu and suggestions. The food was fresh and made to perfection... Quite possibly the best burger I've ever had! My husband was very pleased with his meal too. I highly recommend eating here

My daughter chose Red Robin for her birthday lunch and we had a great time. Our server was amazing! We fell in love with her in a very short time frame. Very knowledgeable about the menu, personable, and attentive. The food was really good as well as their margaritas and shakes. So good that we dug in quickly without taking pictures like I normally do. Bottom line I loved it and would recommend it to many.

Your standard Red Robin. The food isn't outstanding or what I would consider "gourmet", but the food fills you up.  Most burgers are around $10 with bottomless steak fries included. The sauces are pretty good (BBQ, Honey Mustard, Ranch), but if you want to try out some specialty sauces, they'll cost you extra. Out of all the burgers I've tried (nearly all of them over the years), the Prime Chophouse I had here was one of the tastiest. The Bacon Cheeseburger and Whiskey River BBQ are solid choices as well. On the upscale (expensive) portion of the menu, the Smoke & Pepper Burger I tried here would have been good if the juice hadn't drenched the ciabatta bun, so it fell apart in my hands. If you're looking to save money, get the Red's Tavern Double, but don't expect much.  They've eliminated Happy Hour specials at the bar and basically price-tiered a bunch of appetizers and drinks. I would skip the appetizers and go for an entree. The drinks are all right, some even bottomless, and the addition of boozy shakes are cool. As for the service and facility, so-so. You're going to have to wait to be seated a while if with a group, and the outdoor patio loses the ambiance of the restaurant. Also, rolling out the tablets for ordering seemed either premature or unnecessary since a server will always come to your table anyway. The functions are still limited and the germaphobe in me slightly freaks out at the thought of having to touch screens that previous diners handled during/after stuffing their mouths, before I even get my own food. The location of this Red Robin is convenient at the center of the mall, so a lot of people will come here. Expect it to be busy often, but your food will usually turn out okay.

Extremely disappointed. I sawonline that they were advertising 35% off all togo orders so i figurded this would be  the perfect time to try them out. I ordered 2 burgers over the phone during my lunch at work to be ready for pick up when i got off at 330. I showed up only to find that my order was NEVER PLACED and no one knew anything of it. So a manager (lela) comes out (didn't appologize) and only offers to start making the food that should have already been ready to go. Unfortunately I could not wait for the food to be made so my girlfriend needed to leave for work at 4pm. They offered nothing to make up for this huge inconvinience..no meal comp..no discount..nothing. all I could do was ask for the corporate number and vow to never waste my money on a business that has zero customer service.

Food wasn't fresh at all i had steal bottomless fries and a cold guac burger. Waitress had 5 tables to serve which most of them were ordering beer took her about 7 minutes to get me ranch. We also ordered the mushroom burger which wasn't fresh at all very disappointed in this respect will not be coming back here.
First time at Red Robin. Me and my daughter  Red Robin. We got Buzz mac n cheese tavern double burger. It's was great.
Sheri is an outstanding waitress. We really enjoyed our meal, and her sweet and helpful nature!

I REALLY HATE, leaving reviews like this! I waited sometime before writing this review, thinking perhaps I missed something or perhaps looking at things differently. I felt, I did not, if I could give this restaurant less then five stars I would have.  We arrived around 5:45pm on March 25th. This place was busy! We were told that our wait time was going to be approx 10 to 15 mins, I was very surprised at the wait time given the fact the restaurant was so busy. Well we waiting 30 min, you'd think they would just tell us 30min?  Once we were sat, our server, Julia Ra, she was very helpful at first, she took our drink order, A beer and a glass of sangria. She came back within a few minutes with our order, then took our dinner order.  We ordered the barbecue chicken wrap, easy enough and a simple bacon cheeseburger with crispy fries. Are only request to Julia was that, the fries be "EXTRA CRISPY" and away she went, and then the waiting, and we waited, and waited! We did see she had enough time to chat in front of us to the busboy.  Our food was finely brought 24min later to the table, by an expediter I am assuming. And "YES" the fries were NOT crispy! Soon there after, Julia showed back up to the table and then quickly said, "I know that's not how you ordered the fries, I've ordered more for you but they will take while! Question? "THEN WHY DID THEY BRING THEM, if it's not what I ordered? So she took back the ones that were initially brought. And the waiting began again, in the mean time we started our meal, got half way through with our meal, and here come the fries, exactly as we ordered them the first time, late but hot and crispy.  At this point we were never to see our server Julia Ra. never to check on us again. We wanted to ask for more fries, but couldn't, so we paid at the kiosk at the table. At that point I wanted to find a manager, to share my experience. I found her sorting menu's, handed her my card and said, "I have just experienced some REALLY bad service and thought you should know" I was then told by the manager, with attitude, Why didn't I come up to her or find her earlier. I was very surprised that answer and didn't know that it was my responsibility as a customer to go find a manager, I would assume that a manager would be aware of unhappy customers through their staff, but wait, Julia Ra. never came back!  We left at 7:24pm shaking our heads we vowed never to return! Want to wish you good luck, this place is screaming for guidance and leadership.  SCRC Chef Ron

Sat for 10 min. No greeting m, no service . It was slow & I watched three servers standing around talking. Two tables were sat after me & received service. When I complained to hostess she seemed indifferent & simply said " I'm sorry". She made NO effort to try to fix the issue. I guess their servers are rich and don't need the money & management clearly has no interest in wanting business. Walked over to Lazy Dog & got prompt & great service.

Been hurt here a few times now. Ever since remodel the staff has changed over and the wait staff attempt to increase tip amount by inflating bill ( charging for drinks with kids meal when they do not know age but assume that child is over 11) and that only hurts tip over all. If you are slow... Lower tip... If you have attitude... Lowers tip... If you are gone for a long period of time.. Lowers tip... If you seem put out by serving... Lower tip... Here is a tip... Tips are NOT mandatory and are earned.  It is not the consumers fault if Red Robin doesn't pay you enough. Sorry. If I could get up and get myself a refill on drink, I would! I was really thirsty and so were kids. Most likely will not be going back to this location. Sad. The food wasnt half bad, but $7 for a tiny kids meal and $2.79 for a kids drink!!?? Really?? Thats 3 2 litters at the store.. Seriously!  Just sad

great burgers...sorry in another Cali's  'great burgers' review I wront bugers...another typo..wrote not wront... bugers....forgive my repeating it twice..yeah why not backspace and correct it LOL... anyways...there are mixed reviews here....I am from the North East...and they just don't do burgers or...lol...like they do in Cali. unless you go big scale and pay 2-3x for the ambience. The all you can eat fries are great. succulent yet crisp.....i am only a Fry guy if they are steamy hot and seriously Catsupt...Davidism...anywho...clean dining and moderate service.  Yet I undertand= lack of outside sunshine with understanding... there are moments..missed...and the service too..yet with a few kindly words, you get choice service....if not overly busy, leaving a good tip..get's you remembered too. A for Burgers B+ for inemities...not sure what that means but sounds right..ikr

Let me start off by saying wait can be long sometimes and can get pretty busy on weekends! Theres not much room in there to wait and it does get pretty packed, felt like i was in everyones way. There's seats outside, but i didn't want to since it was freezing out. Food is decent, unlimited fries. I was hoping food was going to be better since it always looks so packed so i was kind of disappointed. For two people mine only came out to $23 which is pretty good. Servers were nice and kind and food came out quick.

Checked into this joint yesterday thinking that we could grab a bite to eat for my sick son. Why did it it take 35 mins after we ordered our food to get our food! I'm sitting at the table and seen 3 others families come in sit down order and get their food while we are sitting there waiting for ours! After 35 mins we finally get our food and my sons food was incorrect! The main one we stopped into this restaurant to feed because his BS was so low and we needed to feed him quick!  I was not a happy camper, my food was not how I ordered it and I let the manager know! He was gracious enough to take my sons food off the bill and invite us back. Don't think that will happen tho!   They definitely need to step their game up!

We ate lunch today at the Temecula store.  Ya gotta try their sweet potato fries. Top that with being BOTTOMLESS, fresh and hot, just like all restaurant food should be served.  Our server made our meal enjoyable. Thanks Red Robyn...

This review is just for the French onion soup and onion rings.  (I had a craving for onions, apparently, and got them to go tonight).  The French onion soup should be renamed 'French onion spaghetti'.  I had to scoop out heaping spoon after heaping spoon of onion slices.  After I finished my broth and crouton I put the pile of onions back into my bowl to see how much it was and I was astonished to see them fill up half of my bowl!  Gross!  As for the onion rings, I saw that a substitution of onion rings for fries was only $1.49 so I figured a side order of onion rings would be somewhere between $3 and $4.  Wrong.  You get five onion rings and it's $5.00.  Their onion rings are pretty big but I don't think their cost or worth is one dollar per onion ring.  Big time disappointed.  You let me down, Red Robin.  :(
Amazing food and friendly service. This was my first time at a Red Robin and I left feeling nothing less than satisfied and I would definitely go back there again.
YUM! They have stepped up their game! Of all the many many times I've been recently, I've been provided with great service! They bring the food out speedy quick.

My wife and I decided to hit up Red Robin on a Tuesday around 1pm with my two young children ages 1 and 2. We get to the area where the host is supposed to be , but she's not. Finally she shows up and take our names down and said it will be like 5 mins, my wife requested to have two high chairs for our two young children. Then wait about tens minutes and the host lets us know they don't have anymore high chairs and if booster seats will be okay. Which for the older child who is 2 that's fine but we still need at least one. So we wait about 20 more minutes. My children are started to get a like crazy waiting for a table. Then at the table they have a big chair that is the height for a bar table, so my child's feet are on top of the table , how is she supposed to eat off the table if she is so high up. Then we asked if another high chair comes available if we could switch it out to get one where she could actually eat her food. After that they brought us the wrong kids meal so now the kids are getting more impatient. Then Have to wait even longer for the food. While my wife and I can't eat because the kids aren't eating yet. So another wasted trip out where we couldn't eat and had a horrible time. Management needs to one check the  number of high chairs and second see if they are clean , those high chairs they brought were so disgusting . You need to clean them at least one a day. It's not hard Red Robin, figure it out

I stopped by this location yesterday for a veterans day meal that I was very thankful for and it was the double Tavern burger with endless fries, the double Tavern burger was very juicy and the cheese really made the burger great I was very happy with the offer, the fries were nice and crisp not too hard and not too soft, not too bad, now the person I was with had a western burger so I tried half of it and I was gravely disappointed by it there way too many fried onions with no flavor to them, the burger was dry and the bbq that was on it was basically nonexistent overall the burger was a fail in my opinion, but the free meal they offered the veterans was a success and I thank you for that Red Robins, the staff was also nice.
Loud, hustle bustle, and lots of kids.  Did I mention loud?  Burgers were good, endless fries, lots of food for the price and convenient before the movies.  Just not my favorite place.

If I could give this establishment zero stars I would do so. I stood at the front for 15 minutes. There was no hostess. I was told 4 seperate times by 4 seperate employees that someone would be right with me but was never helped. I was even told by one employee the manager would be right with me and they never came!  While we waited several other people who had been waiting to put down just their name got up and exited the building. There were many booths and tables open.  Will not ever return to this location. Customer service is very important to me and we received no attention let alone good service.  Glad we didnt stay because the wait time and person taking our order would surely effect how we were treated from the get go

This place is packed. We came on a Friday night and Saturday and both times the wait for a party of 4 was 30+ minutes. Keep that in mind when deciding whether this place is worth it. Also the patio was deserted and closed which I presume is due to their lack of staff. I wonder why that would be difficult to correct. Anyway, food is average. Would have gone someplace else had I not already committed the time.

Wish I could give less stars! Worst service ever! The waitress took our order waited 30 mins. Brought our food it was wrong so we waited for 20 mins more and the order was still wrong. We took it anyways Cus we were starving. Couldn't get refills. We asked to people to get us fries and they couldn't manage that. Wasted our time and money here. If you want good service go to Taco Bell. It's quicker and you actually get what you order. Never coming here again!
All the times I've eaten here I haven't experienced food poisoning and it took this time to make me not come here anymore, sadly. Loved it before!

Went here for a "free birthday burger". My husband was told it would be a 5 minute wait. It was a Friday night but there were MANY (more than 1/2 of the restaurant) was open tables. As we have both been servers and worked in the restaurant industry we understand that there may have no been enough servers on yet, ok. Almost 20 min later, we were finally seated.  After getting off to sort of a negative start, the waitress took our drink order and then our order. Chips and salsa was TINY. Maybe a 4 oz portion cup of salsa? Like something you would put a side of ranch in, for 5 people? She should have warned us that it was pretty small. Good thing the salsa was way too spicy for our kids, it was enough for the 3 adults in our party.  Next two of us shared a burger and added soup. Soup was $3.50 EACH for maybe a small, again, 4 oz portion. I have little sauce dishes at home this size, very disappointing. Maybe lower the price to $1.99 for something this small. Also the soup was brought out with our burger and fries, so we got to choose between eating cold soup after the burger, or cold burger after the soup  She said the fish platter was delicious, and perhaps it is to some, but my husband said it tasted like a platter of frozen fish. We realize red robin isn't a fish place; but he felt it tasted like it had been thawed and then re frozen, then served. Just overall not a good value for $15.99 or whatever. The 70$ we spent there for frozen fish, small side items and one burger shared was overall disappointing. This did include 2 kid pasta meals).  Server was ok but seemed to come back to us like 3 times as we were finished but we hardly saw her after putting in drink order.  I wouldn't say we would never return, I would just ask about portion sizes and be more specific with my requests when I order (please bring out the soup first, etc) we also weren't able to use the free burger coupon because it was one of 4 burgers that were excluded from the promotion. Would have been nice to know that at the beginning. Overall a disappointing experience but we have had better ones in the past.

Hands down the best gluten-free burger I have had so far!! What a great experience from start to finish!  The manager and server were both attentive to my dietary needs. The manager gave me a tablet thing to play with so I could figure out what I can order. Turned out I could order my favorite burger - the Red Robin Gourmet burger and the bottomless fries and a strawberry lemonade. I used to get onion straws added on top, but couldn't. But their gf bun was fantastic!! I looked up the company that makes them and unfortunately, they are super expensive to buy and ship. But oh-well! And the fries! I love dipping them in that poppyseed/mustard dressing.  Service was wonderful. Our glasses never ran empty.  I wish we had a RR closer to our house!

Daniel is an amazing waiter! Always remembering the littlest of details and is always so nice and upbeat. Really seems to care about his job. We've been here several times and have lucked out to get him as our waiter twice now. Food is pretty good! I'll be craving the American patty melt again soon- delicious! Clean, fast, and friendly service. Will be back!

terrible service, family of six waited over 20 minutes to be seated with two booths open. After being seated waited another 20 minutes on a waitress while another family walks right in and is served immediately. Waitress also messed up multiple orders and overall a terrible experience. Would not recommend this Red Robin to anyone in Temecula Valley, better iff taking the family to McDonalds. *update* after speaking to the manager, decided to give RR a 2nd shot and the service and quality of food has been fantastic. Same family of six at the same booth. Thank you to the management at RR for convincing me to give this place a 2nd chance, it was well worth it

We came to Red Robin to enjoy the atmosphere, in that it was a nice summer evening and they have a nice patio. The hostess told us they "would see" if a server would serve us on the patio (even though the patio is the closest are to the kitchen). Since it seemed apparent they wouldn't accommodate us, we told them we would just eat somewhere else. They then found a server to help us. Our waitress told us they are assigned certain areas which they aren't supposed to travel outside of. I ordered the cobb salad, and was told the restaurant was out of eggs, and was offered cucumber as a substitute. I asked if I could have some other protein added to the salad, but was told no (nicely, but still no). The server was very nice and polite, but it seems the management & the rules constrain the servers from accommodating simple, and IMO reasonable, requests by the patrons. No problem with the food, but seriously considering never returning because I feel like we're asking something extraordinary for simple requests.

Apparently today was the launch of the new menu. I guess they didn't practice it. Or discuss it. Or really know it was a thing.  Over an hour for three burgers, a grilled cheese and chicken strips. My youngest ordered a pizza. It sat under the heat lamps for over 25 minutes. Much longer, but that's how long I times it.  My burger was cold and dry. My wife's super dry. You should see the side salad. Literally 8.5 bites.  No longer a decent place to go.

I had  double tavern with smoke Bacon and bottomless fries......the pattys are small and I'm not really a potato woman.   Nevertheless the waitress was excellent and so was her memory.  She didn't write down anything  and I was with a party of 12. Their food is okay

The beer was cold, but the fries were not hot.  The server was outstanding!  She was very kid friendly and parent friendly as well, she made sure to ask me before offering my daughter another beverage.  The fries came in a metal tube which seemed rather odd.  I do wish I was aware that on the kids meal that the sides were "bottomless" just like the adult fries and I had two beers one tall and one short and the price difference was .69 cents, had I know. This before I ordered the short I would have ordered two talls, as my sister was driving.  Great service at this restaurant, food was good.

This Red Robin is awesome! We had excellent service, everyone's food was prepared as requested,and it was very clean. I have been to this location many times and never had any problems. Now the reason for the four stars We asked our server if they were still giving the discount if you show them your pokemon go Pokédex and he said we would go ask his manager. He came back and said "Yes , and everyone's check has already been discounted." We did not have one of the kiosk at our table  to pay ,so the server disappeared for a while to find one. When he came back with the kiosk the server said "I just talked to my other manager and he said we aren't doing the discount so all your checks are back to the original price."  We understood but it was frustrating to tell us we had the discount then taking it away. Overall, great food, very clean, and the server was great. But after one manager took away a discount another manager agreed give us, it left a bad taste in our mouth.
It's a chain. It is what it is. The food holds up and the wait staff it 4.5 out of 5 stars.  They carry craft beers. But this place is a bit GRIMEY. All the wood work needs a clean. What gives?

I'll start with the service, we went at dinner on a Saturday, it was busy as expected but we didn't mind waiting. Our party of 6 were quoted about 30 min by the host. After about 20min a woman and her family came up and sat by the patio. They were there about two min before two employees came around from the back and grabbed the party and ushered them to the patio and sat and started waiting on them. Another 20 min goes by, its now 8 pm and no one has called us. We go in and ask what's going one seeing as how all parties have been sat now. We were finally sat and the manager apologized for the wait and the fact that the other party was sat in front of us. The manager also said if we ordered two appetizers she would comp them and asked that we order them with her. So we did. Our apps came, our food came. It was all dry and appeared to have been under a heat lamp for some time. When the bill came nothing was comped and a manager was apparently no where to be found so we were forced to pay for appetizers we wouldn't have even ordered. NOT GOING BACK, also contacting corporate.

We just came back from our visit to this awful restaurant. There was hardly anyone in this place and our food still took a long time - at least 30 minutes waiting. Our server (named Kait) didn't bother to say anything until about a minute before the food came out that our order was coming up. When the food finally arrived, the server just dropped it off and walked away without saying a word. The food was very mediocre. The burgers hardly had anything on them. I had the Mac and Cheese Tavern thing. It had one wilted small piece of lettuce and the Mac and Cheese was about 5 macaroni noodles. The burgers had no taste at all. My kid's child plate had about enough food for a 4 year old to eat and she is 10. The food was just cheap on quality and quantity. Our server never refilled our drinks. She asked one time if we wanted refills, left and never came back. She never offered additional bottomless fries. The people behind us asked her twice for bottomless fries, which she never brought to them. The pay at table device never gave us a receipt. I wanted to complain to management but my husband was so disgusted he just wanted to get out of there. We will never go back to this lousy place again.

My son and I stopped in for a quick lunch. I ordered the whiskey barbecue chicken sandwich and the grilled cheese for my son. Our waitress was quick and our food was good. The hostess was not very hostess like and didn't act as long she enjoyed her job at all:  Overall it was a nice, quick typical red robin meal.

We waited for 2 hours for a table. They were busy but not 2 hours busy. People that came an hour after us were called and left by the time we were called. The servers didn't seem to care nor have any sense of hustle to sit us after 2 hours. So far we have been sitting for 30 minutes and no food. Bottomless fries? Yeah but they never bring out a second round. It takes 20 minutes to get a new round. Never coming back.
My first time here at Red Robin. I tried the whisky BBQ burger and it was good. I like the option of paying at the table from the mini touch screen device.

Recently visited this location and was happy to be greeted by a very pleasant hostess that you guys have there her name is Linsey  she was very hospitable and very caring to me and my family you guys have a star winner there!! We just love her so yeah and the food is great lol thank u

So you would think the hostess would know what section is open. Is it unreasonable to expect that by the time I park the car WAY out in the parking lot and walk to the theatre and get the tickets that one could possibly have had the drink order taken.  Oh and the stupid little iPad order taking device that you point to is going to cost you your tip. If I put my order in and get my own check WHAT DOES THE SERVER DO? The only reason they get three stars is they put some giddy up in their step on our food. Which was over cooked fish and chips for me. But the plain cheeseburger was done well, not that it's hard.

Great place for burgers. Steak fries are great too. Totally kid friendly but not chuck cheez kid friendly.  Servers are competent and friendly.  Noise level is on the high side with music and an abundance of tv's. Although I didn't have drinks this trip the bar area appeared to have a selection of cool beers to choose from. I will have to review these another time :)

Red Robin to me is one of those restaurants that never fails me. I just stopped by a few days ago with my girlfriend as I finally received my free birthday burger.  The wait times on a weekend are terrible, but luckily I came in on a Wednesday and walked right in to a booth. I got a California Chicken burger... absolutely delicious. Fries are always just the right amount... and the freckled lemonades that I had were just right.  Overall, a big thumbs up... one of the best places to dine out at the Promenade mall.

Better than I remember. I wasn't a big fan or Red Robin.. Always seemed a little generic and over priced to me. My opinion has been changed.   The service was decent, quick and correct.  The food was actually pretty good. I had a burger with onion strings and steak sauce with bacon. It was well cooked just the way i asked for it and really juicy and tasted great.  Bottomless steak fries are a bonus and the season salt on them makes them even better.   Not really much else to say about Red Robin. It's a burger and a guy or girl brings it to you!  A good experience that will bring me back again.

Sadly we had a very poor experience tonight and it was most certainly due to our waitress and consequently the manager. It began when we initially sat down and had our drink order taken she walked away from our table before my wife could even finish getting her request out. We assumed it was because she was having a rough day because it was certainly not do to the restaurant being busy in fact it was less than a third full from what we could see. She then came back took our order and that went okay. Our food arrived in time and the food itself was decent as it usually is. This is where things took a turn for the worse she did not come back to our table for the entire time we were there and we kept asking passing servers for things like Phillips on drinks forks and napkins. At the end of the meal I finally asked bypassing server if he could find my waitress and get me our check. After about 5 minutes she arrived apologized place the check on the table and simply walked away. I was paying in cash so we waited for 15 minutes before we finally got up walked to the front and ask the hostess if she could find our waitress so I could get my change. At that point my wife walked outside with my kids thinking it wouldn't be very long and I kid you not when I say this but it was another 15 minutes sitting in at this point a nearly empty restaurant waiting for someone to bring me back my change I asked for the manager who took another 5 minutes to come out and asked me what is it that I need it I explained the situation he went back was gone for an additional 10 minutes before coming back with my change and not even an apology. So in total we sat for close to an hour after we had paid our check waiting for our change. I explain to him the situation but frankly I don't think he cared. I guess thats it for Red Robin for us.

Idk what I do but 2 times in a row I've bad mediocre customer service. This time the waitress was pretty in our face and making decisions for us. She was cool, just gnarly. But much better than the orange location by far. Food was delicious!

Against my better judgement I was dragged into this pit of a burger establishment.    Burger was horrible.  "Bottomless" fries....  You can barely get a server to bring show up at your table...then when you order another basket it took 10-15 mins for them... And they show up with like 5 tiny fries on them. Epic fail.   Five guys across the street is a much better option for the buck.   Or go to burger paradise -  in - n - out.

Cant say I enjoyed the service. The so called "bottom less fries" is a scam. They start out giving you a handful of fries. I probably had about 12-15 fries in my basket. Then the waitress stayed so busy she couldn't take the time to refill our basket until our meal was over. On a positive note, I did enjoy the new burger with mac n cheese. I used to like their Red Robin commercial. But now all I think about is the bad service. We are heading back to Islands!!!

I was going to write a 5 star review based on the food quality and very attentive service we received from Daniel. However,  towards the end of our meal, Brittany, who we had never met, comes over to our table and without introducing herself or explaining anything,  asks my daughter to hand her the ziosk. My daughter was using it as she had been playing a game on the ziosk and had reached a high level. Despite this,  Brittany takes the ziosk and says "I think you have the wrong one". She then proceeds to reset the ziosk and sets it down on the table next to us and gives us a new one. Really? Was that really necessary to do at that moment?  Still no explanation,  no "I'm sorry", no eye contact, she just walked away. I don't think I have ever given a 1 star before but this ruined our dinner outing with my daughter. THEN, when we looked at our bill on the ziosk, we see we were charged $1.99 as an "entertainment" fee. Um, I don't think so! I wouldn't have been so irritated if Brittany would have handled the situation in a more professional manner. To start,  she should acknowledge the 3 human beings sitting at the table and realize one of them was in the middle of a game.

Chris is a super good waiter! really friendly good food suggestions on top of things. I have had several other waiters/ waitresses as I come here often, however I drafted this review the night Chris served us. Over all I love Red Robin, I love this one in particular because of the mall discount while I'm working. I have never had a bad meal there. All the burgers are fantastic so they are always a safe bet. Recently I have ventured into the chicken sandwiches, which are also all fabulous. Their salad that has bar-b-que sauce on it is absolutely to die for, sorry I don't remember the name just the picture. Recently they got new menus so you no longer have to worry about punching the person sitting next to you in the face while reading it, they are now a much smaller version and in book form.  Strawberry (Freckled) Lemonade is delecious, sometimes too many strawberries floating around for me but some people love that. When you get the french fries try the garlic fries with a side of pesto yuuuuuummmmmy! Make sure you sign up for a Red Robin Royalty card so you get your free biorthday burger and other goodies throughout the year.

Red robin is a perfect stop in or around the mall.. My husband and I like to stop here for a drink before our movie nights, and I like to attend with friends for a quick lunch.. Every time I dine I hit the bar!! I'm a picky person when it comes to the hospitality staff, being in the industry, Chelsea V is never a disappointment. Chelsea has a beautiful smile, wonderful personality, and positive attitude. Everything you want in a staff member and as your waitress/bartender. Go see and ask for Chelsea!!! You won't be disappointed!!!!

I had a lot of fun here! Food is always great, they make sure everything is clean and the waitress we had was a blast. Her name is Kymber and I think that's how it's spelt, (I got a C- in english, sue me) and it went from a basic dinner with my friends into a total blast! She gave excellent customer service and totally helped us out when it came to refills as well as answer any questions we had. She even helped me with the menu because I'm boring with what I get. Aside from all that, it was a great time. Keep on rockin Kymber and thanks for the great service!

The food is decent here, but the fries and ranch dressing are the two things which attract customers! This restaurant is super loud so it isn't a good date night type of place but perfect for the kids. They have some pretty awesome drinks and their reward system is pretty cool too! Try it out. I love going and grabbing a salad and fries! Bummed that they changed their policy on dogs. You can no longer bring them on the patio, even though it is spacious enough for animals.

So, my fiancé and I came in 2 weeks ago for a dinner date night. We've been here before and never have we received the stellar service of that night! Our servers name was Emily, and she was on top of it and friendly! We will be back and request her again!
I love this place. This location is pretty busy on weekends because it is right next to the mall. I have had great service there. The food is fantastic. Happy hour all the time??? Count me in!

Ok, $9 for a riblet basket and you get over charred nuggets of bone with no meat at all.  Maybe one did.  Got my shot glass Of salsa and chips about 90 seconds before my crappy riblets. Fail.  Never offered me a refill but offered everyone else one.  Also, hate beans in my soup so I looked at the description and no mention of beans. Asked server and she said no beans.  FULL of beans.  Wtf.   And don't get the "bold boneless chicken wings" unless your idea of bold wings is chicken bites with a splash of buffalo sauce.  Not dripping with sauce like the menu.   So tired of paying this much for crap service and worse food than the swap meet.
Red Robin just for you a haiku: Burger mighty once Now small shrunken shriveled charred Still expensive be Yumm, not so much

Huge fan of Red Robins - Buffalo Clucks and Fries with ranch for the win! My wife and I have gone here on numerous occasions, usually a great experience. We've had two experiences that weren't so great, specifically mood of staff (bad day?) and poor service.  On one visit, apparently they had charged us for a monster shake without telling us, so we were surprised to get the same size when we decided on a monster shake during a future visit. When we told the waitress and explained this -- that we had hoped to have a larger serving of shake expecting the monster to be bigger than our previous visit, they just shrugged it off and explained that what we received was the monster shake. Good service would have had them make it right and given a full refill for the confusion and because we were apparently charged for something previously that we didn't know we were being charged for (very bad).
Usually a pretty good burger..honestly I think there best menu item is the 6 dollar tavern double.... you can't beat it..

I've been to Red Robin a few times in Temecula and once in Grapevine, TX and Flowermound, TX. Not my choice of places to eat, but my kids like it so we have to be flexible. :) I have to say all Red Robins are not created equal. The one in Temecula was far better in terms of ambiance, food, and service. Other locations do not give a "fun" vibe like this one.

Three strikes and they are out.  This was always my kids favorite place to go...and I found it acceptable for a burger place.  Strike One -- eliminating the garlic fries (with the oil and real garlic, not the powder junk they now have).  Strike Two - Salad mix has changed...yuck!  Strike Three - Eliminated Free Refills on Kids Mac n Cheese. Unfortunately for them....there are too many other burger options in the area.  Bye Bye Red Robin.

Visited this location Today 4/10/16 for lunch with my family... It was the best experience I have ever had at Red Robin... Excellent Service as well as food... Shout out to our waitress Jaclyn for excellent service

Not the best service, our server was not very friendly. Food took a long time and I didn't get utensils or napkins. My son ordered the kids pizza and looks like the ones you buy from market. My chicken sandwich was alright but Islands definitely makes it better. My fries was cold.  I thought some of the burgers were expensive. Will not go back.

Won't be back! Tonight we tried take out. BIG mistake!! Most of the order was missing. Items we paid extra for were missing. Cesar Salad had no dressing on it and no extra that I ordered as mentioned. Burgers/patty melt were awful!! Soggy and inedible. Dinner for 3 costing over $40.00 was a waste of money. I will not return again.

Ate at this location last night, service was amazing. Waiter came to our table many times to check on us, both restaurant managers also came over to clear the plates and just to see how everything is going. When we ordered desert, the waiter heard us wrong, let us keep the wrong desert for free, and didn't charge us. That was excellent service. And the food was great too!

Good, fast and friendly service... even during the lunch rush! Not to mention the burgers! The Burning Love burger is my absolute favorite. Vegetarian options on each burger and bottomless sides. This is as good as it gets folks.

Red Robin has a great variety of food including burgers and shakes. Not to mention the bottomless steak fries are a pleasant bonus! Needless to say I enjoy the food. However, at this particular location the service was a bust! My server Lauren was a complete nightmare for a waitress. She was neglectful the entire night, I had to ask for refills on coke and fries (in which she made me feel like I was asking for too much), she got my order wrong not once but twice, then proceeded to act snooty. The food was great, but the service put a damper on the whole experience. Lauren could definitely learn a thing or two on customer service skills :(

We've been going here for years, and we have yet to have a negative experience. We went in on Sunday and told our server Taylor that we were in a hurry, we got amazing service and were in and out in less than 45 minutes. Well done!

For a burger place, expected more. I have had better burgers at non burger spots..  They have super cool game tablets on the table that you can so use to order and pay your bill. Pretty cool! Long wait, boo! Overall just okay, would not go back anytime soon.

Burger was amazing!  Service was great!  Bottomless fries are wonderful and delicious!  My favorite thing was the bottomless strawberry lemonade!  Almost half the glass is real strawberries so you need a straw for the lemonade and a spoon for the strawberries!  I had 4 of them and will definitely be back!  I've been to Red Robins all over.  I just moved into this area and this one was the best in every category!  All around great place!

Remodel stinks but my issue is the new food options. Got rid of so any great menu items and altered many of their past ones. They don't even offer eggs on their Cobb salad anymore.  Staff was great and apologetic though.

Service was ok. Friendly staff no bad vibes. Food is not so great. The kids fruit cup was pathetic. It's a dressing cup filled with mush. Fries came out cold and chicken was watery. I remember the endless fries basket was huge and fries always hot. This location has definitely lost that. Overall rating was mainly the food.

Forgot to charge me for a soda, asked me to order drinks on the ziosk. Waitress was nice...told us to "leave a good review because that's how I get my shifts" as I was paying on the ziosk. Food was eh. Fries seemed a little undercooked compared to normal and we're not seasoned like normal. Little things but not a big deal.

Good service, good burgers.  Lots of choices for everyone.  The prices are good.  Not sure who could keep eating the unlimited fries, I was stuffed after my burger and sweet potato fries.  Lots of different dipping sauces for the fries, the garlic aioli was super good, even on my burger.

Good food, mediocre service. Have come in about 3 times in the past couple months with one other person and it always takes about 15-20 minutes just to be greeted by the server. I work at the LQ location, and I understand that sometimes servers get backed up or become slammed with tables... but when it's early in the day, barely any people.. I don't see why it would call for crappy service.

Is open during remodeling, which is kind of odd when you walk in and see the decor gone and tape where wood molding was. My server was poor, did not ask me how I wanted my burger and brought me out a way overcooked one. Finally got the hostess's attention, and reordered the burger to be rare. Second one came out well done as well, The manager made it right, though, and brought me a different entree which was comped (I wasn't looking for a comped meal, just something to eat). Was bummed

We are semi-regular customers, maybe eat here 4-5 times a year.  Typically we have OK service and restaurant is basically clean for a place that looks like it hasn't been remodeled since a few presidents ago. Not this time. Stopped in on a recent weeknight with my kids for a burger around 5:00PM.  Restaurant was basically empty except for a couple of tables.  Host took 3-4 minutes to s-l-o-w-l-y wander to the front desk.   Strike 1 - He had no smile and a shaggy unkempt beard.  I don't like people with shaggy facial hair around my food.  At least he wasn't our server.   Strike 2 - he led us to the closest table to the restrooms, not my favorite spot to sit.  Especially in a near-empty restaurant.  So I asked for a booth instead, and he whined that they don't usually give parties of three a booth (really?).  I looked around and figured out why.   Strike 3 - All the booths were very messy and it was obvious the tables had sat dirty for a while.  Maybe since the lunch hour.  He said it would a a few minutes to clean a booth.  This was at 5:00PM on a weekday, not exactly a peak time, but the exact time everyone should be busting their tails to get ready for the supper rush.   No one seemed concerned that the place looked like hell.  Two waitresses were back at the bar yakking loudly and flirting with the bartender.  No busboys in sight.  We waited a few minutes and walked out.  If the front of the house was that unclean and nobody cared I can only imagine the conditions in the kitchen.  With BJ's, Burgers & Beer, 5 Guys, TGI Fridays, Islands, Karl Strauss, and more all within 5 minutes there's no reason to eat at this particular Red Robin.

So my wife and I used to split time between Red Robin and Islands, when we wanted a burger or Chicken Sandwich.  I stopped drinking soda and only order Iced Tea.  Red Robin and Islands both had great tea, but Red Robin decided to change theirs.  We have not been back since, the new Iced Tea is horrible!  I also have to say, I have never been to any restaurant where my chicken sandwich is consistently barely warm, instead of hot.  They put the order/payment machine on the table, makes RR look like they are just lazy, and want to heard you in and out quickly.  The new trays with the little tin of fries was the last straw.  Place has done what many places have done, changed something that worked, and replaced it with something that sux!

Went to dinner and manager was the one who greeted and sat us down. He was very personable and all smiles with a great attitude. Food was good and affordably priced. My husband and I love to get the soup and sandwich combo. Service was great with a smile and each of us received our own little basket of fries w/ranch! Im not a fry person but for some reason I like the fries here! Manager came around and checked with us during our meal which we appreciate because only professional and customer service oriented management does this. He was still as friendly and conversational as when he first sat us down.  We come here often and it does not disappoint. It says a lot about a person's character when managers step in and do line staff jobs if need be - with a genuine smile on their face.
food was delicious great costumer service the food was served pretty fast i like that they have the all you can eat fries and the hamburgers were huge!!!!!!!

We went on a Wednesday afternoon... late lunch not a big crowd. Waited a couple minutes to be seated- not bad.  The host gave the 3 of us a table near the coin games... near the dark corner of NO return.  We sat for at least 10 minutes and weren't greeted by anyone yet. Then finally the  waitress came around and said I'll be right with you guys... then never returned. The booth and the three tables in front of us were so dirty and full of plates, too. Service sucks and was nonexistent! We left after waiting 5 more minutes without ordering, without drinks, without acknowledgement........... While we were waiting, we were working up our appetite by pretty much memorizing the entire menu from the time we were sitting there... but I can't complain about burger hunger since we hurried to make up for wasted time and enjoy in-n-out instead.  Red robin- you were a big disappointment.
Not as good as last time but still good service food was great, will continue to come back but now service expectations are different compared to my first review.

Our waitress was nice, but very...forgetful... My boyfriend asked for a root beer and she brought out a dr. Pepper. She fixed the problem. I ordered the BOCA burger, wrapped in lettuce with tomato. So they bring out the BOCA burger, on a bun...with nothing on it lol ugh. So she got it straightened out and I had to wait for a new one. Food was ok. But I think maybe the waitress should write down the orders to ensure accuracy.
Nice lunch with the wife, had the chili chili cheeseburger and an endless root beer float. Food was awesome and our server Brad was on point too. Never been disappointed at RR. We'll be back!
Bottomless fries were up to par as well as their burgers, I just didn't like the taste of their raspberry ice tea, tasted better after I added sugar.

The ambiance of this particular Red Robin is neat.  Unfortunately we had a server that was training and the server that was overlooking their services did not do great with follow-ups.  They forgot our Oreo Cookie Shake so we didn't receive it until we were half way through with our food.  You would think they'd make up for their mistake and not charge us for it in the end - Nope.  Nothing to write home about regarding the food.  I gave it the rating more so for the atmosphere rather than the quality of food, and hope that they start caring for their guest service rather than running up a check for a better tip.

This Red Robin is always on point! Great service and great food every time. I got the whiskey river burger and a mini wedge salad, both were good and burger was hot. Server was at out table or around to help at almost all times of our visit. Sweet potato fries here are actually the bomb! Thank You to this location and  for making your business shine!

I just ate at this spot a few hours ago and I was really impressed with everything.  The hostess was very friendly and was quick to get my boys and me to a table.  Our waitress was awesome and on top of everything.  The manager was walking around checking on people and he looked like he really enjoyed what he was doing.  We all know the food is the best so what's left to say?!? I love me some Red Robin! Thank you thank you!

Love this place but disappointed that they got rid of the twisted ceaser chicken salad....was my favorite thing...havent been able to find anything else that i love. Service is always good, staff is very helpfuk and friendly.

ALEXIS made our visit the perfect one. Yes, the food was good, but this waitress had the personality and the work ethic that helped make our family's afternoon a great one.  THANK YOU ALEXIS!  You are an asset to the company!!!

Food was good. Got the Bleu Ribbon. Waitress was slow on refills of drinks & fries, to the point that even the store General Manager asked if we needed more fries and still didn't get any for another 15 minutes. But I gave 4 stars because of the new tablets at the tables! Makes paying and ordering so much easier.

I went there today for lunch cause my brother was craving a burger. I had just satisfied my burger craving yesterday, so I wasn't much in the mood for one, but here goes.  We were seated immediately upon entering, and our very pleasant waitress Sheri took our drink order. She gave us ample time to go over the menu and decide what we wanted. I got the smoke and pepper burger, it looked so good in the picture. With thick pieces of bacon and deliciousness, but when I got it I found the bacon was so thin it was transparent. Also I didn't recall the menu stating the burger came with pickles or else I would have asked to omit them. Overall I was a bit disappointed in my selection but the service was good. She was prompt with refilling our drink and bottomless fries, or in my case bottomless broccoli! Lol

I had dinner at this joint with my family today. The wait was long but once inside, the service was quick. We all ordered burgers and a salad, drinks and water. My turkey burger was too soft. Taste was ok. Not my favorite gourmet burger, but ok. In comparison, lazy dog burgers taste much better. Their fries were a bit mushy, but tasted ok. Overall service was a breeze, pleasant waitress, and efficient!

Pretty busy tonight. Our server, Brad, awesome! I noticed he had a lot of tables he was waiting on yet still made our experience enjoyable. Made sure everything came out right, drinks never empty, and super charismatic! Ps: LOVE the tenders and their ranch.
OMG the wait is out of control. I may never come to this Red Robin. I was a 15 minute wait and turned out to be 45 minutes. Every time we visit this location the wait time is unacceptable
Everything you would expect from a restaurant chain. These burgers will keep you full and satisfied. And they a a good selection drinks and alcohol.

The bleu ribbon burger is soooo goooood!  I haven't been to a Red Robin since I lived in Wa almost 4 years ago.. this location didn't dissapoint.  I love that it's right next to the movie theater for dinner and a movie date night with the hubbs :) We will definitely be back.. P.s. I love the drink menu! I ordered a Blue Moon concoction that was really yummy!
Great place I always come here for lunch always nice and juicy they've never messed up on my order even though I always call

I went to get my free birthday burger at this location, and the service was bad. I wasn't happy with the food quality and the service.
